shapes

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • shapes.Game

  • public abstract class Game
extends java.lang.Object
    A game built using the Shapes framework.

    Game is one of the two most important classes (along with Shape) for building a game using the Shapes framework. To make a game, you will subclass Game and override the setup() and update() functions. In setup(), you will write code that will execute when your game begins, and in update() you will write code that executes once per frame.

    Game also has a few useful static methods and constants. For example, you can call Game.getAllShapes() to get all the shapes that currently exist in your game.

      • setBorderBehavior

        public static void setBorderBehavior(Game.BorderBehavior behavior)
        Set the behavior of the window borders. The options are:
        • NONE: allow shapes to leave the window.
        • SOLID: prevent shapes from leaving the window. (See Shape.setSolid(boolean).)
        • BOUNCE: make shapes bounce when they hit the window borders, i.e., reverse direction as if bouncing off a physical border.

        Syntax example: Game.setBorderBehavior(Game.BorderBehavior.SOLID);

        Parameters:
        behavior - specifies how shapes will act when they reach the border of the window.

      • getBorderBehavior

        public static Game.BorderBehavior getBorderBehavior()
        Returns the behavior of the border windows. The options are:
        • NONE: allow shapes to leave the window.
        • SOLID: prevent shapes from leaving the window. (See Shape.setSolid(boolean).)
        • BOUNCE: make shapes bounce when they hit the window borders, i.e., reverse direction as if bouncing off a physical border.
        Returns:
        a BorderBehavior specifying the way shapes react when they reach the border of the window.
